translated: For the purpose of sitting down for the Buddha,ğŸ”½I gave a handful of grass.
Having given to the God of Gods,
I further purified my mind;
Having worshipped the Fully Enlightened One,
I departed facing north.
Not long after I had gone,
the King of Beasts killed me;
Having been killed by the Lion,
I died right there.
The deed I did in the presence of,
the Best Buddha, the Unsullied One;
Having been well released like a flood,
I went to the world of the gods.
There was a beautiful sacrificial post there,
made by the power of my meritorious deeds;
With a thousand branches, a hundred spokes,
with flags, made of green (jade).
